net.java.jddac.common.util
Class Log

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.util.Log

public class Log
extends java.lang.Object

JDDAC logging facility. This class is a simplification of the J2SE log facility and was created to support J2ME applications. It uses the same levels as the J2SE Logger class, and the methods that are implemented use the same signature where possible. This class forwards all logging messages to any LogHandler classes that have registered using the addHandler method.

In order to reduce the impact of logging (especially in J2ME environments) the user should always utilize the isLoggable method when logging other than exception conditions.

For example, the following log line will cause the toSting() method to be invoked every time the line is reached, even if the resulting string is not logged due to the log level being set lower that Log.FINE. In some cases the additional formatting for the log string can put a severe strain on the system when it resides in loop constructs or the cost of string conversion for a particular message is high.

log.log(Log.FINE,"My object value is "+myObject.toString());

The recommended way to do this is to use the isLoggable method to avoid the string conversion:

if (log.isLoggable(Log.FINE)) log.log(Log.FINE,"My object value is "+myObject.toString());

See the class LogInit for techniques for customizing the logging level as instances are created.
